title: Mozambique supports returning migrants
text: Mozambique has contacted and delivered key information to returning migrants in order to stop the spread of Covid-19. The government has proactively provided testing and phone-screening for migrants and the families of migrants.

title: Tunisia extends visas and offers aid to migrants
text: Tunisia has extended visas, granted financial and in-kind aid, and asked landlords to postone rent payments for foreigners residing in Tunisia.
stats-comment:
Tunisia employees at least 60,000 seasonal migrant workers (Brookings, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Tunisian labour union advocates for migrants
text: The Tunisian General Labor Union (UGGT), along with MPs and other public figures, has urged the government to allow migrants and refugees access to healthcare. The group has also been supporting migrant workers by collecting and distributing donations.
stats-comment:
Tunisia employees at least 60,000 seasonal migrant workers (Brookings, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Australia lifts working restrictions for international nursing students
text: In Australia, 20,000 student nurses have had restrictions on their working hours lifted in a bid to help the crisis in aged care caused by Covid-19.
stats-comment: of nurses in Australia are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Australia extends visas for seasonal migrant workers
text: Australia has extended the visas of migrant workers on their Seasonal Worker Programme and Pacific Labour Scheme to ensure that the agricultural sector will ‘get the labour force it needs’.
quote-text: ’This is a common sense change to support employers, seasonal workers, and our agricultural sector during the many challenges we are facing across the economy due to the Covid-19 pandemic’.
quote-author: Minister for Employment Senator Michaelia Cash
stats-comment: of the labour force on Australian vegetable farms are temporary migrant workers (FAO, 2020)
story-source: Department of Education, Skills and Employment (Australia)

title: Bahrain announces temporary amnesty for irregular migrants
text: Bahrain has promised irregular migrants the ability to regularise their residency status until the end of 2020 without being fined.
stats-comment: of Bahrain's population are foreign citizens (GLMM, 2015)

title: China sends doctors and medical supplies to Italy
text: China has sent 300 intensive-care doctors, Covid-19 test kits, and protective equipment to Italy, responding to an Italian plea for masks in March. China has also sent aid to Spain, Poland, Greece, and the Balkans in a show of ‘coronavirus diplomacy’.

title: Kuwait offers amnesty to undocumented workers
text: Kuwait has offered amnesty to undocumented workers in the country. Workers are entitled to free airfare, food, and accommodation during a fine-free repatriation and will be eligible to re-enter the Gulf through legal channels in the future.
stats-comment: of Kuwait’s workforce is foreign-born (GLMM, 2012)

title: New Zealand classifies seasonal agricultural employees as ‘essential workers’
text: New Zealand has classified seasonal agricultural employees as essential workers during the Covid-19 pandemic. All recognised seasonal employees have had their visas renewed for a further three months.
stats-comment:
11,078 seasonal workers arrived in New Zealand in 2018 (New Zealand Immigration)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Qatar commits to paying salaries for migrant workers affected by Covid-19
text: Qatar has announced that quarantined migrant workers, or those undergoing treatment for Covid-19, must receive full salaries. Anyone unable to return home has been given assurances of medical treatment, food, and lodging.
stats-comment: of workers in Qatar are migrants (Migrant Policy, 2013)

title: South Korea extends visas and halts deportations
text: South Korea has extended visas for workers by 50 days, providing they reached the country under the Employment Permit System. Nearly 18,500 migrants are benefiting from the decision and have retained the right to residency.

title: Vietnam explores relaxing entry for high-skilled migrants
text: Vietnamese government officials have proposed lifting a ban on over 8,400 highly-skilled migrant workers, arguing that it had been ‘difficult to find replacements for them’ internally.

title: Wanning, China supports unemployed migrant workers
text: In Wanning, the Chinese government has created temporary roles for migrants to ensure rural poverty reduction targets are met. Public sector jobs including disinfecting and guarding have been created, with transport, health checks, and food provided.

title: Albania sends doctors and nurses to Italy
text: Albania has sent 30 doctors and nurses to Italy’s Lombardy region to assist the response to Covid-19. Lombardy is the worst-hit Italian region in the crisis.
quote-text: ‘Today we are all Italian. And Italy will win this battle’.
quote-author: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama, accompanying the Albanian medical team to the airport

title: Belgium allows asylum seekers to work
text: Belgium has allowed people who have applied for asylum to work throughout their application process and any appeal.
stats-comment:
Almost 28,000 people submitted an application for asylum in Belgium in 2019 (CGRA)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Campagnano di Roma, Italy receives support from migrant cooperative
text: In Campagnano di Roma, a cooperative of young African migrants called Barikama has been growing, packing, and delivering boxes of fresh food to the local community during the Covid-19 outbreak.
quote-text: ‘It’s a beautiful thing that we are helping feed the community in these terrible times’.
quote-author: Barikama member Cheikh

title: IOM calls for inclusive, shared approaches for protecting migrants
text: The International Organisation for Migration has urged all states to uphold their obligation to assist anyone crossing the Mediterranean during the Covid-19 crisis.
quote-text: ‘The crisis should strengthen our collective resolve to preserve life, protect rights and find common, adaptable solutions to the challenges that affect us all’.
quote-author: IOM press release

title: International organisations call for EU member states to include refugee health workers in national Covid-19 responses
text: The Council of Europe and UNHCR are calling for governments to include refugee health professionals in national responses and are recommending the use of the European Qualifications Passport for Refugees.
quote-text: ‘Refugees are ready to ‘show their solidarity' and give back to the communities sheltering them’.
quote-author: UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi
stats-comment: of key workers in the EU are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020)

title: France allows refugees with non-EU medical certifications to practice
text: France has allowed refugees with non-EU medical qualifications to practice during the Covid-19 response. Refugees whose diplomas have not yet been recognised can practice as an associate, under the responsibility of another doctor.
stats-comment: of French doctors are foreign-trained (Eurostat, 2018)

title: Germany explores putting asylum seekers to work in agriculture
text: Germany has explored relaxing employment bans for asylum seekers as a means to fill agricultural shortages. MPs supporting the measure cite government data showing almost 160,000 refugees ready and willing to work.
stats-comment:
applied for asylum in Germany in 2018 (OECD, 2016)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Ireland calls for retired doctors living abroad to return
text: On St Patrick’s Day, Ireland launched a call for retired doctors living abroad to return to aid the Covid-19 response. The country’s ‘Be on call for Ireland’ campaign has received more than 70,000 responses.
quote-text: ‘Your country needs you’.
quote-author: Irish Health Minister Simon Harris
stats-comment: of doctors in Ireland are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Ireland aims to allow refugees and asylum seekers to register as doctors
text: The Irish Medical Council has suggested that refugees could provide ‘essential support; to its health service during the Covid-19 crisis and argued that registering foreign nationals was the current priority’.
stats-comment: of doctors in Ireland are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Ireland offers financial and healthcare support for migrants
text: Ireland has moved to provide Covid-19-related healthcare to all, regardless of immigration status, including testing for Covid-19. The Pandemic Unemployment Payment provides financial assistance for all workers in Ireland, including regular and irregular migrants.
stats-comment: of key workers in Ireland are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020)

title: Italy supports childcare for ‘essential workers’
text: Italy has offered babysitting vouchers for families with parents in essential work. The subsidy of up to 600 EUR ($689 USD) is available to working asylum seekers and refugees and can be redeemed on care for children under the age of 12.
stats-comment:
applied for asylum in Italy in 2018 (Asylum in Europe)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Lithuania suspends deportations
text: Lithuania has suspended deportations of foreigners with expired leave to stay during quarantine. The country has also released migrants from administrative liability for illegal stay.
story-source: Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of Lithuania

title: Norway sends healthcare staff to Italy
text: Norway has sent a team of 25 doctors, nurses, and logistical staff, to aid Italy’s Covid-19 response. The team is based in Lombardy, Italy’s worst-hit region.
quote-text: ‘Solidarity in Europe is not a theoretical exercise… We must help each other when a crisis hit’.
quote-author: Norwegian Health Secretary Bent Hoeie

title: Odemira, Portugal creates quarantine housing for migrant agricultural workers
text: Odemira, a municipality in Portugal with a large number of migrant agricultural workers, has set up housing for migrant workers. Large buildings such as sports halls and pavilions have been adapted to accommodate up to 500 workers in order to prevent Covid-19 transmission.
stats-comment: More than 60% of farm workers in Odemira are foreign-born (NY Times, 2014)

title: Poland relaxes visa renewal requirements
text: Poland has relaxed visa renewal requirements for foreigners during Covid-19. Under new legislation, foreigners are not required to submit any applications to extend their stay, with permits renewed automatically.

title: Portugal regularises all migrants and asylum seekers
text: Portugal has regularised all migrants and asylum seekers, following a government announcement that all migrants with pending residence permit applications have been regularised.
quote-text: ‘Ensuring the access of migrant citizens to health, social security, and job and housing stability is a duty of a solidary society in times of crisis’.
quote-author: Minister of Internal Administration Eduardo Cabrita

title: Saxony, Germany calls for foreign doctors to help during Covid-19 pandemic
text: The Saxony State Medical Association has published a call on Facebook for German-speaking foreign-qualified doctors who do not yet have licenses. Saxony is known as the heartland of the far-right nationalist Alternative for Germany (AfD) party.
quote-text: ‘I am waiting for their call’.
quote-author: Syrian-migrant ENT (ear, nose, throat) doctor Shadi Shahda in Saxony

title: Seine-et-Marne, France recruits refugees as seasonal workers
text: Seine-et-Marne, France, has recruited refugees to fill gaps created by a halt in seasonal worker migration due to Covid-19. Refugees from local migrant and asylum shelters have been recruited to pick ripe strawberries and asparagus, and plant produce to harvest later in the year.
stats-comment:
In March, 2020, France lacked 200,000 agricultural workers due to Covid-19 (Financial Times, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Spain recruits migrant doctors and health workers
text: The Spanish government has hired nearly 200 migrant health professionals living in Spain to join the national health system (SNS) to help combat Covid-19.
stats-comment: of doctors in Spain are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Spain authorises temporary hiring of new farm workers
text: Spain has authorised temporarily hiring thousands of migrants and jobless people to address agricultural labour shortages. The unemployed will receive state benefits as well as their wages.

title: Ter Apel, Netherlands sees asylum seekers volunteering to disinfect grocery carts
text: In Ter Apel, a village in the Netherlands, asylum seekers have volunteered to disinfect grocery carts, walkers, and keys to protect fellow residents from Covid-19 at a local supermarket.
quote-text: ‘As refugees, the least we can do is to help the Dutch people as they have done everything toward us at Camp Ter Apel’.
quote-author: Refugee volunteer Raffat Altekrete

title: UK farms call to bring migrant agricultural workers to work
text: 150 fruit and vegetable pickers from Romania have arrived at Stansted Airport in April to work on UK farms. Large farms have warned that fruit and vegetables would ‘run out’ if the UK government failed to provide seasonal migrants in the agricultural sector as the country had entered ‘an unprecedented time’.
stats-comment: of employees in food manufacturing in the UK are migrants (IPPR, 2019)

title: UK automatically renews visas for all foreign NHS workers
text: UK NHS migrant doctors, nurses, paramedics and their families ( whose visas were due to expire before 1 October 2020) have had their visas automatically extended for a year free of charge. Restrictions on the amount of hours student nurses and doctors are allowed to work have also been lifted.
quote-text: ‘We owe them a great deal of gratitude for all that they do’.
quote-author: Priti Patel, UK Home Secretary
stats-comment: of health and social care workers in the UK are non-British nationals (ONS, 2020).

title: UK MPs campaign for indefinite leave to remain for foreign nationals in the NHS
text: In the UK, several MPs have been campaigning for foreign nationals working in the NHS to gain the right to remain indefinitely.
quote-text: ‘Those who have put their lives at risk for our country are welcome to live in it’.
quote-author: David Lammy, UK MP
stats-comment: of health and social care workers in the UK are non-British nationals (ONS, 2020).

title: UK suspends reporting, registration restrictions, and resettlement for asylum seekers
text: The UK government has suspended and cancelled all registration, reporting, and resettlement requirements for asylum seekers, and put all voluntary returns, evictions, and statelessness applications on hold. 350 people in detention have also been released during the pandemic, with an urgent call for all detention cases to be reviewed.
stats-comment:
applied for asylum in the UK in 2018 (OECD, 2016)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: UK public calls to fast-track registration of migrant doctors
text: The UK government has been pressured by the public and MPs to fast-track the registration of qualified doctors from overseas into the NHS.
quote-text: ‘Our heroic NHS doctors are stretched to breaking point. At the same time there are hundreds of overseas-qualified doctors, many of whom arrived in the UK as refugees, that right now are not permitted to practice’.
quote-author: Help Refugees petition
stats-comment: of doctors in the NHS are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Wallonia, Belgium translates Covid-19 information for migrants
text: SetisW, a social interpretation initiative of the Wallonia region, is translating essential information on Covid-19 into 14 languages. This service helps migrant key workers and newcomers to Belgium to access and understand official safety advice on Covid-19.
stats-comment: of key workers in Belgium are migrants (Joint Research Centre, 2020).

title: Buenos Aires, Argentina allows migrant doctors to practice
text: In Buenos Aires, Argentina, Venezuelan doctors have had their requalification licenses fast-tracked to work in local hospitals to allow over 1,000 already-qualified doctors to begin practicing.
quote-text: ‘Venezuelan doctors are willing to work with courage, vocation, and will’.
quote-author: Head of Civil Association of Venezuelan Doctors Indira Acosta Cedeno

title: Chile suspends requalification requirement for migrant doctors
text: Chile has suspended their requirement for migrant doctors to requalify in an effort to equip their healthcare system for ‘caseloads on a European scale’.

title: Colombian NGO provides mental health support for migrants
text: In Colombia, a non-profit run by Venezuelan migrants has begun providing support and advice to migrants affected by the Covid-19 outbreak, recognising the emotional and physical strain placed on many people and communities.
stats-comment:
1,400,000 Venezuelans were living in Colombia in 2019 (United Nations)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Colombia allows Venezuelan migrant workers to access healthcare
text: Colombia has allowed Venezuelan migrants to access healthcare during the Covid-19 crisis. The country vowed to continue its attention to the vulnerable migrant population and ensure they were prioritised for access to essential services and can fulfill their basic needs.
stats-comment:
1,400,000 Venezuelans were living in Colombia in 2019 (United Nations)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Cuba sends doctors to Italy
text: Cuban doctors have been sent to Italy to help fight Covid-19 in one of the worst affected areas of the country, Lombardy.
quote-text: ‘Of course I’m scared, but I was scared when we went to Africa to cure Ebola in 2014, but we fulfilled our mission and came back’.
quote-author: Leonardo Fernandez, Cuban doctor in Lombardy

title: Peru recruits foreign health professionals
text: The Peruvian government has called for foreign-trained doctors and nurses to help their country in the fight against Covid-19.
stats-comment:
In 2018, Peru faced a deficit of almost 17,000 medical specialists (Peruvian Ministry of Health)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: British Columbia, Canada registers international medical graduates as associate physicians
text: The British Columbian College of Physicians and Surgeons has licensed thousands of international medical graduates as associate physicians in efforts to combat Covid-19.
stats-comment: of doctors in Canada are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)
story-source: College of Physicians and Surgeons of British Columbia

title: California, USA announces financial support for irregular migrants
text: California is the first US state to give cash stimulus payments to irregular migrants, offering $500 USD to 150,000 adults left out of the $2.2 trillion USD stimulus package approved by Congress.
quote-text: ‘We feel a deep sense of gratitude for people that are in fear of deportations that are still addressing essential needs of tens of millions of Californians’.
quote-author: California Governor Gavin Newsom
stats-comment: of California’s workforce are irregular migrants. In 2019, they paid more than $2.5 billion in state and local taxes (TIME, 2020)

title: Canadian healthcare sector calls for access to healthcare for new migrants
text: Canadian doctors, nurses and activists have called on provincial governments to give immediate access to free healthcare for all newcomers during the Covid-19 pandemic.Typically, new arrivals in Canada have to wait at least three months to access provincial health coverage.
stats-comment:
One million migrants are projected to enter Canada between 2018-2020 (Canadian House of Commons, 2017)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Canada exempts temporary migrant workers from travel restrictions
text: Canada has put in place an exemption to the international travel ban by enabling temporary migrant workers to travel to Canada to work in the seafood and agri-food sectors.
quote-text: ‘At least 30% of the workforce is temporary foreign workers’.
quote-author: Industry representative Jerry Gavin
stats-comment:
travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Canada supports employers’ quarantine measures for workers
text: Canada has given employers $1,500 CAD ($1,100 USD) per worker to help with quarantine measures, acknowledging that the labour shortage depends on foreign temporary workers.
stats-comment:
travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Massachusetts, USA allows foreign doctors to practice medicine
text: Massachusetts has allowed doctors, nurses, and students qualified abroad to practice medicine in an effort to staff two 1,250-bed convention field hospitals.
quote-text: ‘These orders will contribute to our efforts to grow a robust community of front-line workers to support our health care institutions’.
quote-author: Massachusetts Governor Charlie Baker
stats-comment: of doctors in the USA are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Nevada, USA waives licensing requirements for foreign medical workers
text: Nevada has waived all licensing requirements for healthcare professionals and administrators qualified abroad. The state has called on those currently unable to practice due to restrictions to join the statewide battle against Covid-19.
quote-text: ‘This is our moment to once again show the world what it means to be Battle Born’.
quote-author: Nevada Governor Stephen Sisolak
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2016)

title: New Jersey, USA waives licensing requirements for foreign doctors
text: In New Jersey restrictions on healthcare professionals have been lifted, enabling recently retired physicians to help with the Covid-19 response and granting temporary licenses to those who have qualified in other countries.
stats-comment: of doctors in the USA are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: New York, USA waives licensing requirements for migrant healthcare workers
text: In New York restrictions on healthcare professionals have been lifted, granting temporary licenses to those who have qualified in other countries.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2015)

title: US classifies agricultural and healthcare workers as ‘essential workers’
text: The US Department of Homeland Security has officially categorised ‘essential workers’, including those in the agriculture, medical and healthcare, and construction industries. Government advice emphasises that these industries are needed to ensure infrastructure resilience and should be considered when implementing state-level Covid-19 restrictions.
stats-comment: of agricultural workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2018)

title: US recruits medical professionals on work or exchange visas
text: The USA has continued to provide emergency visas to medical professionals on a work or exchange visa programme. All migrant medics already residents in the US have had their programmes and visa conditions extended to help the country-wide Covid-19 response.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2015)

title: US states petition to allow migrants access to healthcare
text: The states of New York, Connecticut, and Vermont have petitioned the US Supreme Court to allow migrants access to healthcare during the Covid-19 pandemic. The petition calls to block a regulation penalising migrants for seeking access to healthcare and social assistance.
quote-text: ‘The regulation impedes efforts to stop the spread of the coronavirus, preserve scarce hospital capacity, and protect the lives of everyone in our communities—citizens and noncitizens alike’.
quote-author: Motion to US Supreme Court
story-source: Department of Education, Skills and Employment Australia

title: India considers portable benefits for migrants
text: India considers portable benefits to migrants, irrespective of their state of residence, by making use of World Bank funding.
stats-comment:
India had 450 million internal migrants in 2011 (World Bank, 2019)
1 dot = 10,000,000 people

title: Japan makes all residents eligible for cash assistance
text: Japan has announced that its cash assistance in response to Covid-19 will be distributed irrespective of nationality. Everyone who has resided in Japan for at least three months and is registered as a basic resident as of the end of April 2020, is eligible for this assistance.
stats-comment:
Foreign-born individuals resided in Japan in 2019 (IOM, 2019)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Russia eases migrant registration requirements
text: Russia has exempted migrant workers from the requirement to buy work permits to legally work and live in Russia from 15 March - 15 June.
stats-comment:
11.6 million foreign-born individuals were living in Russia in 2019 (UN DESA)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: Tasmania, Australia extends aid to temporary workers
text: The Australian region of Tasmania has announced that temporary visa holders who are able to demonstrate immediate financial hardship will be eligible for $250 AUD ($175 USD) for individuals, and $1,000 AUD ($700 USD) for families
stats-comment: of the labour force on Australian vegetable farms are temporary migrant workers (FAO, 2020)

title: Spain allows migrant doctors to practice
text: The Spanish government has allowed more than 2,000 Venezuelan doctors awaiting their credential evaluation to practice medicine.
stats-comment: of doctors in Spain are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Colorado, USA waives licensing requirements for foreign medical workers
text: The Colorado state governor has waived licensing requirements for medical workers licensed in other states and other countries.
stats-comment: of healthcare workers in the USA are foreign-born (MPI, 2015)

title: Canada halts deportations in face of Covid-19
text: The Canadian Border Security Agency has halted deportations and the Immigration and Refugee Board has cancelled and postponed all in-person hearings.
stats-comment:
One million migrants are projected to enter Canada between 2018-2020 (Canadian House of Commons, 2017)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Ontario, Canada creates portal to match non-active healthcare professionals with employers
text: The province of Ontario has launched the Health Workforce Matching Portal to match non-active health care professionals, including those internationally-educated, with employers. However, licensing requirements have not been eased for internationally-educated healthcare professionals.
stats-comment: 39% of doctors in Canada are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Canada provides aid to all residents, including migrants and international students
text: Canada has announced $27 billion CAD ($20 billion USD) in state aid, including $450 CAD ($350 USD) per week for people that have lost their jobs or facing reduced hours due to Covid-19. Migrants and international students are eligible for this payout.
stats-comment:
One million individuals are projected to enter Canada between 2018-2020 (Canadian House of Commons, 2017)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: US politicians lobby to extend employment authorisation for migrants during Covid-19
text: US congress members have sent a letter urging the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to automatically extend employment authorisation for all migrants whose employment authorisation documents (EADs) are about to expire.
stats-comment:
Foreign-born individuals resided in the USA in 2019 (IOM, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000,000 people

title: Canadian advocacy group calls to include undocumented migrants in Canadian government benefits
text: Canada's Migrant Rights Network has called to include undocumented migrant workers and those with expired social insurance numbers in government benefit schemes.

title: Canadian NGOs call for a reopening of the Canadian border
text: The Canadian Council for Refugees, Amnesty International Canada, Canadian Association of Refugee Lawyers, and BC Civil Liberties Association have argued that the closure of the border to refugees is unnecessary and unjustified. They argue that it endangers both refugees and public health.
stats-comment:
One million migrants are projected to enter Canada between 2018-2020 (Canadian House of Commons, 2017)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Turkish refugees make masks for key workers
text: Refugee volunteers in Turkish Red Crescent community centres across the country have produced protective masks for health workers and people in need. The community centres have been traditionally used for vocational training for refugees and host communities, but are now being used to produce more than 500,000 sterilised masks a month.
stats-comment:
Foreign-born individuals living in Turkey in 2019 (UN DESA, 2019)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: England, UK allows international medical graduates to practice as medical support workers
text: An NHS England scheme has allowed international medical graduates and doctors to fast-track their accreditation and become medical support workers.
quote-text: ‘For me, a doctor’s life is to try to save lives as much as you can’
quote-author: Syrian surgeon Hussam Allahham

title: UK healthcare professionals push the government to eliminate 'hostile environment' healthcare surcharge
text: UK Doctors, nurses, and carers have pressured the government to remove the £625 ($800) NHS surcharge that migrants must pay for themselves and each family member. This surcharge was introduced with "hostile environment" legislation meant to discourage illegal migration and health tourism.
quote-text: ‘It feels unfair that we are risking our lives on the frontline, and we are being penalised by having to pay this large sum out of our own pockets’.
quote-author: Carl Perez, UK nurse from the Philippines
stats-comment: of health and social care workers in the UK are non-British nationals (ONS, 2020).

title: Wuhan, China gives cash assistance to migrants
text: The Chinese province of Wuhan has provided temporary assistance to the quarantined migrant population, with each individual given 3,000 CNY ($430 USD). As of 13 March, the measure had supported almost 6,000 people, with a total cost of around 16.1 million CNY ($2.25 million USD).

title: Brazil provides monthly emergency fund to informal workers
text: Brazil has provided monthly emergency aid of 600 BRL ($116 USD) to informal workers, this measure extended over the course of three months. In order to identify and reach informal workers, Brazil is using existing platforms, and introducing new mechanisms for registration.

title: Myanmar repatriates migrant workers from abroad
text: Myanmar has organised relief flights for Myanmar migrants stranded in Thailand. Once in their home countries, returned migrant workers were transported to their communities of origin where stayed in community-based facility quarantine centres.
stats-comment:
3.7 million individuals emigrated from Myanmar in 2019 (UN DESA)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: Uzbekistan provides training for migrant workers
text: Uzbekistan has made migrant workers eligible for language and vocational training paid for by the Covid-19 anti-crisis fund.
stats-comment: 1.2 million migrants lived in Uzbekistan in 2019 (UN DESA) 1 dot = 100,000 people

title: The Philippines sends cash assistance to Filipinos working abroad
text: The Philippine's Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) has provided 10,000 PHP ($200 USD) in cash assistance per Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) whose work has been affected by Covid-19.
stats-comment:
5.4 million individuals emigrated from the Philippines in 2019 (UN DESA)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: South Africa extends visas for migrant workers
text: South Africa has automatically extended temporary residence visas expiring 15 February or later. Migrants with expired visas will not be declared 'undocumented,' and will not be penalised if they return in the future.
stats-comment:
4.2 million migrants lived in South Africa in 2019 (UN DESA)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: Germany allows seasonal farm workers to enter the country
text: The German government has exempted Eastern European seasonal farm workers from border restrictions. This measure allows up to 40,000 seasonal farm workers to enter Germany in April, and another 40,000 workers to enter in May. Among other requirements, seasonal workers will undergo a medical check upon entering the country.
quote-text: ‘Today we have found a pragmatic and goal-orientated solution which meets two justified requirements. Protection from infection on one side and securing the harvest on the other side’.
quote-author: German Agriculture Minister Julia Kloeckner
stats-comment:
applied for asylum in Germany in 2018 (OECD, 2016)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: The Gambia creates a cash-for-work programme for returning migrants creating PPE
text: In The Gambia the IOM has supported the reintegration of returning migrants, mainstreaming COVID-related activities into existing initiatives. As part of reintegration assistance migrants are participating in a cash-for-work initiative producing personal protective equipment (PPE).
quote-text: ‘This innovative initiative utilizes the skills of returnees to meet an urgent public demand’.
quote-author: IOM Chief of Mission in The Gambia Fukimo Nagano
stats-comment:
118,500 migrants left The Gambia in 2019 (UN DESA)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Chihuahua, Mexico enlists migrant medical professionals to support the Covid-19 response
text: The State of Chihuahua, Mexico, has invited Central American health professionals to work. These migrants are stuck in Juarez due to the Migrant Protection Protocols programme, which requires would-be American migrants to await their asylum decision in Mexico.
quote-text: ‘The health emergency has brought challenges, but it also has made us come together, locals and foreigners, for this one purpose of helping the community through the pandemic’.
quote-author: Head of Chihuahua Population Council Enrique Valenzuela

title: Canada requires employers to pay migrant workers during their mandatory 14-day quarantine
text: Canada has announced that, under the new International Mobility Program, employers must allow workers to complete 14 days of quarantine upon arriving in Canada. This new rule requires employers to pay migrant workers during this period, even if they are unable to work.
stats-comment:
travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Peru regularises migrants during Covid-19 pandemic
text: Peru has classified all migrants awaiting regularisation as regular during the Covid-19 pandemic. Temporary Stay Permits will also be automatically renewed.
stats-comment:
In 2019, Peru was home to 782,200 foreign-born individuals (UN DESA)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Bahrain mandates a higher standard of accommodation for migrant workers
text: Bahrain has made private sector employers responsible for raising the standard of accommodations for migrant workers. This included reducing the number of workers per room, increased sanitation facilities, building isolation facilities, and regular inspections.
stats-comment: of Bahrain's population are foreign citizens (GLMM, 2015)

title: Italy temporarily regularises undocumented migrants in the agriculture, domestic work and social care sectors
text: Italy has announced that thousands of undocumented migrants will be allowed to apply to temporarily stay and work under an amnesty announced as part of a major stimulus package, agreed after weeks of government negotiations. New residency permits will be valid for six months, with a focus on agriculture, domestic work and social care.
quote-text: ‘The food on our table comes from these fields. Now we must hand over those rights which have been denied to those who work in them’.
quote-author: Minister for the south of Italy Peppe Provenzano
stats-comment: Italy is at risk of losing 25 percent of its harvest due to shortages in migrant seasonal labour (Coldiretti, 2020)

title: Bavaria, Germany calls for foreign doctors to help during Covid-19 pandemic
text: The state of Bavaria has called for aid from foreign doctors who do not yet have licenses, these doctors would be allowed to practice under the supervision of German-licensed physicians.
stats-comment: 20% of doctors in Germany are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany calls for foreign doctors to help during Covid-19 pandemic
text: The state of North Rhine-Westphalia has called for aid from foreign doctors who do not yet have licenses, these doctors would be allowed to practice under the supervision of German-licensed physicians.
stats-comment: 20% of doctors in Germany are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: Qatar requires employers to provide for migrant employees
text: Qatar has put in place several measures to protect migrant workers. Measures include requiring both worker and employer consent for changes to salary and unpaid leave, and employer responsibility for housing and feeding employees after ended contracts, until workers can be repatriated, at the employer's expense.
stats-comment: of workers in Qatar are migrants (Migrant Policy, 2013)

title: Cox's Bazar sees refugee volunteers distribute healthcare packages in refugee camp in Bangladesh
text: Rohingya refugee volunteers in Bangladesh's Cox's Bazar camp, the world's largest refugee camp, have put together and delivered packages of medical supplies, including masks, gloves, soaps, and medicines.
stats-comment:
595,000 refugees were living in the main Kutupalong refugee camp in 2020 (UNHCR)

title: Quebec, Canada sees asylum seekers volunteer to help in social care
text: In Montreal, asylum seekers are among those who have volunteered to work at long-term care homes. The majority of asylum seekers living in Montreal North work in food production, healthcare, and security.
quote-text: ‘Guardian angels’.
quote-author: Quebec Premier Francois Legault called asylum seekers volunteering at long-term care homes.

title: German farmers fly in seasonal agricultural workers
text: German farmers have chartered flights to bring in seasonal farm workers from Romania and Bulgaria. Farmers must register workers with local authorities, develope a hygiene plan, and house workers in a socially-distanced manner.
quote-text: ‘Everybody feels a bit scared, but we need to work’.
quote-author: Romanian seasonal worker Gabriel Moraru

title: Canada launches agri-food immigration pilot
text: Canada has announced its new Agri-Food Immigration Pilot, a three-year pilot targeting labor shortages exacerbated by Covid-19, in the meat processing, mushroom, greenhouse crop, and livestock raising industries. The AFIP primarily provides a pathway to permanent residence for temporary foreign workers already in Canada. Under the AFIP, 2,750 applications will be accepted annually.
quote-text: ‘Attracting and retaining talented workers is essential to help grow our economy and improve the living standards of all Canadians’.
quote-author: Canadian minister for immigration Marco Mendicino

title: Washington, DC events group provides relief funding for irregular migrants
text: A Washington, DC, USA company, Events D.C., has developed a $18 million USD hospitality and tourism relief fund. $5 million USD is dedicated to aid undocumented migrants, who have been especially impacted by lockdown measures.
quote-text: ‘We know there's significant need in the District of Columbia for those residents that unfortunately don't have access to funds otherwise’.
quote-author: Events D.C. board member Greg O'Dell

title: UK scraps National Health Service surcharge for migrant healthcare workers
text: The UK has committed to exempting migrant National Health Service and care workers from the current healthcare surcharge of £400 GBP ($500 USD) (set to increase to £624 GBP ($800 USD) in October 2020). This surcharge is applied to migrants moving to the UK from outside the European Economic Area.
quote-text: ‘Those working to save lives in our NHS and social care sector are heroes’.
quote-author: Priti Patel, UK Home Secretary
stats-comment: of health and social care workers in the UK are non-British nationals (ONS, 2020).

title: Uzbekistan provides resources and support to returning migrants
text: Uzbekistan has implemented the Safe Migration in Central Asia project (in-part funded by USAID) to aid returning migrants through informational resources; referrals to essential services; alternative livelihood support; and skills training.

title: Finland welcomes non-EU agricultural workers and allows asylum seekers to work
text: Finland has increased the quota of agricultural workers admitted to the country from outside the European Union (EU) from 1,500 to 3,000. The government also announced plans to amend the Aliens Act (until 31 October 2020) to allow asylum seekers to take up agricultural work without administrative delays.
stats-comment:
temporary migrants worked in Finnish agriculture in the summer of 2018 (Nordic Labour Journal)
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Kuwaiti organisations coordinate to provide support to migrant workers
text: The ILO, the International Domestic Workers' Federation, and local civil society organisation, Sandigan Kuwait, have supported migrant workers in the country. Through bi-weekly virtual meetings with migrant worker community representatives, the organisations ensure that food, information, and health care (including mental health) are reaching migrant communities.
stats-comment: of Kuwait’s workforce is foreign-born (GLMM, 2012)

title: Sri Lanka exempts remittances from taxes
text: Sri Lanka has exempted remittance flows from some regulations and taxes in order to counteract the economic downturn and decreased remittances due to Covid-19.
stats-comment: Remittances accounted for 7.9% of Sri Lankan GDP in 2018 (World Bank)

title: Zimbabwe government acts to support remittance transfer agencies
text: Zimbabwe has permitted money transfer agencies to open three times a week to enable non-digital remittance transfers into the country.
stats-comment: Remittances accounted for 5.6% of Zimbabwean GDP in 2018 (World Bank)

title: Moldova provides unemployment benefit to returning migrant workers
text: Moldova has set the minimum unemployment one-time benefit to 2,775 MDL ($157 USD). This measure aims to benefit returning migrant workers, who are made eligible for the emergency period under condition of purchasing medical insurance, which costs around 3,875 MDL ($229.50 USD) per annum.
quote-text: ‘We have to support the returning labour migrants as they will be coming from very hard situations’.
quote-author: IOM Chief of Mission in Moldova Lars Johann Lonnback

title: India's Supreme Court mandates free transport for returning internal migrants
text: India has announced that railways and buses cannot request fares from stranded migrant workers attempting to get home during the lockdown. The Court has also mandated that stranded migrant workers should be provided shelter, food, and water by the state.
stats-comment:
India had 450 million internal migrants in 2011 (World Bank, 2019)
1 dot = 10,000,000 people

title: IOM publishes migrant worker recruitment guidelines
text: The International Organisation for Migration (IOM) has published guidelines to reduce risk for migrants, while acknowledging the essential role they fill.
quote-text: ‘Many industries in the global economy are heavily dependent on migrant workers. Without them, health care services, agri-food production, manufacturing, and retail services would grind to a halt, threatening an already fragile global economy. Yet very often, gaps in migration governance and, in particular the regulation of recruitment, leave migrant workers vulnerable to exploitation’.
quote-author: Laura Thompson, IOM Deputy Director General

title: Chicago, USA announces financial support for irregular migrants
text: Chicago city government has provided $5 million USD in aid ($1,000 per person) to residents excluded from the federal government's coronavirus relief package. This benefit includes irregular migrants.
quote-text: ‘The money that the city of Chicago puts into our communities, we do that without regard to citizenship’.
quote-author: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot
stats-comment:
Foreign-born individuals resided in the USA in 2019 (IOM, 2019)
1 dot = 1,000,000 people

title: Arizona, USA community group provides support to migrants with aid
text: Arizona community group, Aliento, has established a relief fund for irregular migrant families across the USA and Puerto Rico to cover rent, utilities, and healthcare for families. The Arizona community clinic, Valle del Sol, provides Covid-19 tests regardless of insurance and immigration status.
quote-text: ‘To have a comprehensive response to a global pandemic, people need to have health coverage, and they need to be able to access services without fear’.
quote-author: Georgetown University health policy expert Kelly Whitener
stats-comment:
Foreign-born individuals resided in the USA in 2019 (IOM, 2019)

title: Turkey sees Afghan refugees produce supplies to fight coronavirus
text: In Turkey, Afghan refugees, supported by the UNHCR, have produced soap and masks to support their community and local hospitals.
quote-text: ‘Such solidarity and cooperation at the local level are also important’.
quote-author: UNHCR Turkey spokesperson Selin Unal
stats-comment:
Foreign-born migrants living in Turkey in 2019 (UN DESA, 2019)

title: Ethiopia assists returning migrants with Covid-19 tests and information
text: The Ethiopian government has teamed up with the IOM to put into place several measures to protect returning migrants (mainly from Sudan, Djibouti, and Saudi Arabia). Returning migrants are given Covid-19 tests, information about the spread of Covid-19, PPE, and travel allowances for returning to towns and villages.
stats-comment:
Have returned to Ethiopia since 1 April, 2020.
1 dot = 1,000 people

title: Singapore commits to improving living conditions for migrant workers
text: Singapore has committed to improving living conditions for migrant workers in the short-term, and has launched a social media campaign to promote greater tolerance as the government moves migrant workers into residential neighborhoods.
quote-text: ‘The aim is to have migrant workers fully included and integrated into Singaporean society’.
quote-author: #WelcomeInMyBackyard campaign volunteer Nicole Ooi
stats-comment:
Total foreign workforce in Singapore (Singapore Ministry of Manpower, 2019)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: India launches public work scheme to employ returned internal migrants
text: India has launched the 'Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyan' programme, a 50,000-crore INR ($6.7 billion USD) plan to provide public works jobs for at least 10 million daily wage migrant workers who have returned home due to the Covid-19 lockdown.The programme provides 125 days of work to the returnee migrants.
stats-comment:
India had 450 million internal migrants in 2011 (World Bank, 2019)
1 dot = 10,000,000 people

title: Armenia launches public works programme for migrant workers unable to travel due to Covid-19
text: Armenia has introduced a public works programme to create temporary employment benefiting Armenian circular migrants unable to work abroad due to travel restrictions. This programme will employ approximately 1,000 beneficiaries in reforestation.
story-source: Government of the Republic of Armenia

title: Tunisia provides cash transfer to migrants abroad
text: Tunisia’s Office of Tunisians Abroad (OTE) has allocated 900,000 TND ($320,000 USD) to help Tunisians emigrants, by cash transfer. Most beneficiaries have been Tunisians stranded abroad, Tunisian students abroad, and irregular migrants abroad.

title: Italy allows migrant workers to apply for income subsidies
text: Italy has allowed migrant workers holding residence permits to apply for the 600 EUR ($690 USD) income subsidy that is part of the Covid-19 Cure Italy stimulus.

title: Thailand creates returnee migrant fund
text: Thailand has made 15,000 THB ($475 USD) available to returnee migrant workers affiliated with the Overseas Workers Fund, a pot of money funded by the fees of employment brokers for the purpose of aiding Thais working abroad. The government has also created over 80,000 jobs for returnee migrants.

title: Singapore cancels levies on foreign workers
text: Singapore has cancelled foreign workers levies due by employers, aiming to reduce the burden on migrant workers and their employers.
stats-comment:
Total foreign workforce in Singapore (Singapore Ministry of Manpower, 2019)
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: Costa Rica includes migrant workers in wage subsidy programme
text: Costa Rica has enacted Plan Proteger, a subsidy programme for workers that have experienced layoffs, reduced hours or lower income due to Covid-19. These workers, including migrant workers, can apply online to claim a monthly benefit of between 62,500 - 125,000 CRC ($110 - $218 USD).
stats-comment: International migrant stock as percentage of total population of Costa Rica (UN DESA, 2019)

title: Estonia extends work permits for migrant workers
text: Estonia has extended work permits for migrant workers in agriculture until two months after the end of the official emergency situation declared by the government in response to Covid-19.
stats-comment: International migrant stock as percentage of total population of Estonia (UN DESA, 2019)

title: Nepal reintegrates returnee migrants into labour force
text: Nepal has created programmes for reintegrating thousands of returning migrants into its labour force. The central bank, Nepal Rastra Bank, is providing lower-rate loans for entrepreneurial activities, such as commercial farming.

title: Greece extends work permits and visas, and creates a pathway for employing irregular migrants
text: Greece has automatically extended work permits, visas, residence permits, and asylum application cards for six months. It has also fast-tracked a procedure for hiring irregular migrants as foreign agricultural workers, in order to fill urgent gaps in agricultural employment.
stats-comment: International migrant stock as percentage of total population of Greece (UN DESA, 2019)

title: India approves plan for affordable housing for migrant workers
text: India has approved a plan to develop affordable rental housing for migrant workers. The plan comes after the "housing conditions of migrant labourers has come under scrutiny during the pandemic".
quote-text: ‘Covid-19 made migrant workers highly visible, and showed they were treated very badly by employers and authorities - they had to beg for food, beg for transport, and go home empty handed’.
quote-author: Professor at the Centre for Development Studies S. Irudaya Rajan
stats-comment:
India had 450 million internal migrants in 2011 (World Bank, 2019)

title: Canada considers a path to permanent residency for healthcare workers
text: Canada has announced that it is considering creating a path to permanent residency for migrant healthcare workers.
quote-text: ‘Guardian angels’.
quote-author: Premier of Quebec François Legault, referring to migrant essential workers
stats-comment: of doctors in Canada are foreign-born (OECD, 2016)

title: New Delhi employs internal migrants to build temporary hospital
text: The city of New Delhi, India, has employed nearly one thousand internal migrants who have been unable to return to their home states during the Covid-19 lockdown. These migrants are building a 10,000-bed temporary hospital and serving in a 2,000-bed COVID treatment center in Delhi.
quote-text: ‘It is the sense of working for the country that will keep us working here despite the threat of infection’.
quote-author: Migrant worker Rajan Bargujar
stats-comment:
India had 450 million internal migrants in 2011 (World Bank, 2019)
1 dot = 10,000,000 people

title: Brazil considers regularising migrants
text: Brazil has proposed legislation for the regularisation of immigrants. While Brazil guarantees basic rights, including healthcare access and welfare benefits, regardless of status, bureaucracy, misconceptions about documentation requirements, and xenophobia exclude immigrants from statutory services and benefits. Under proposed legislation, hundreds of thousands of people who are undocumented or have a pending immigration case would be eligible for residency status for up to two years, with the possibility of renewal for an indefinite period of time.
quote-text: ‘We're not asking for new rights. We're reclaiming the ones we already have under the law and that weren't handed to us on a plate – we fought for them’.
quote-author: President of nonprofit Presença da América Latina Oriana Jara

title: Scotland pushes UK government to allow temporary migrants recourse to public funds
text: Scotland has pushed the UK government to remove no recourse to public funds restrictions on temporary migrants during the Covid-19 pandemic.
quote-text: ‘We have been very clear that nobody should find themselves destitute during this crisis due to circumstances beyond their control’.
quote-author: Scottish government spokesperson
stats-comment:
1.38 million people in the UK are subject to the NRPF condition (The Migration Observatory, 2020) 
1 dot = 100,000 people

title: Huelva, Spain fruit companies house stranded migrant workers
text: Fruit companies in Huelva, Spain, have housed Moroccan strawberry pickers who have been trapped as their country has not allowed repatriation due to Covid-19. Normally, employers of seasonal fruit pickers provide them with accommodation during the harvest. Due to Covid-19, the firms have allowed workers to stay and have taken on the costs.
quote-text: ‘The coronavirus pandemic has shed light on the system's inability to protect the pickers human rights and dignity’.
quote-author: Member of APDHA Jose Maria Castellon

title: Illinois, USA clinics provide free medical services to migrant workers
text: Illinois, USA clinics have worked with state and local health departments, through the Community Health Partnership of Illinois, to test migrant agricultural workers and provide health services regardless of a patient’s ability to pay.
stats-comment: 36% of Agricultural Workers patients in the US lack health insurance (2018, National Center for Farmworker Health)

title: British Columbia, Canada pays to quarantine and feed migrant workers
text: British Columbia, Canada has put in place a programme to protect migrant workers. It cost the province about $10 million CAD ($7.5 million USD) between April 2020 - July 2020, as the government has put up 4,000 temporary migrants. The programme quarantines migrant workers in hotels, paying for their accommodation and food.
quote-text: ‘The pandemic has created the opportunity, and obligation, to focus on migrant workers’ health and housing and put a spotlight on food security and systems’.
quote-author: Agriculture Minister Lana Popham
stats-comment:
travel to Canada as temporary foreign workers each year (CBC, 2020)

title: India sends medical team to Kuwait
text: India has sent a team of doctors and healthcare professionals to Kuwait to assist in the response to the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: India develops helpline for migrant workers abroad
text: The Indian Ministry of External Affairs has developed a call-in help centre to aid Indian migrant workers abroad with queries about Covid-19.
quote-text: ‘Our missions abroad are working round the clock and responding to queries from Indian nationals abroad’.
quote-author: Ministry of External Affairs official

title: Peru allows foreign-trained medical staff to practice in public hospitals
text: Peru has authorised foreign-qualified doctors and nurses to practice in the country's public sector hospitals without needing the supervision of a Peruvian doctor. The majority of immigrant doctors recognised will be Venezuelan.
quote-text: ‘In this way, all doctors residing in the country will join this national cause’.
quote-author: Prime Minister Pedro Cateriano
stats-comment:
from Venezuela now live in Peru (El Pitazo, 2020)

title: Canada grants permanent residency to asylum seekers who cared for pandemic patients
text: Canada has granted permanent residency to about 1000 asylum seekers across the country who worked in a hospital or long-term care home during the height of the Covid-19 pandemic.
quote-text: ‘The program is a way to to thank those who put themselves at the greatest risk of contracting the coronavirus’.
quote-author: Federal Immigration Minister Marco Mendicino
stats-comment:
were processed by Canada in 2019 (Government of Canada, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: New Jersey, USA allows undocumented immigrants to obtain professional licenses
text: New Jersey, USA has allowed undocumented immigrants to obtain professional and occupational licenses to work as doctors, nurses, electricians, counsellors, cosmetologists, and in other professions.
quote-text: ‘New Jersey is stronger when everyone is given the opportunity to contribute and everyone is given a chance to live their American Dream’.
quote-author: Governor Phil Murphy
stats-comment:
are undocumented residents of New Jersey (State of New Jersey, 2020)
1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Refugees in Kutuaplong, Bangladesh volunteer to aid in Covid-19 response
text: Rohingya refugees in Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh have volunteered to educate the community on proper hygiene, as well as about the spread, symptoms, and testing of Covid-19. This work has been performed in response to an 80% reduction of humanitarian workers in camps.
stats-comment:
live in 13 square km in the camp (CNN, 2020)

title: Lisbon, Portugal turns Airbnb's into homes for key workers
text: Lisbon, Portugal has offered to pay landlords to turn short-term lets and vacation rentals into "safe rentals" for key workers, many of whom are migrants.
quote-text: ‘Prioritising affordable housing for the hospital staff, transport workers, teachers and thousands of others who provide our essential services is possible’.
quote-author: Mayor Fernando Medina

title: Campania, Italy adopts resolution to support vulnerable groups during Covid-19 pandemic
text: Campania, Italy has adopted a 604 million EUR ($714 USD) resolution to support businesses and vulnerable groups during the pandemic. This includes special funding for African communities involved in agricultural work, and immigrants living in informal settlements. The region will provide for temporary housing for immigrants, transport services, and awareness campaigns regarding Covid-19.

title: Lublin, Poland allows foreigners to obtain a social security number during Covid-19 pandemic
text: Lublin, Poland has allowed foreigners to obtain a social security number (PESEL) during the Covid-19 pandemic. The PESEL allows immigrant workers to obtain sick leave, purchase medication from pharmacies, and access state services.

title: US-based private organisations push for the inclusion of refugees in vaccine distribution
text: Several private organisations have created measures to ensure equitable distribution of a Covid-19 vaccine regardless of immigration status. This includes Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations, which have created the Covid-19 Vaccine Global Access (COVAX) Facility, and pharmaceutical companies, such as Johnson & Johnson and AstraZeneca which has affirmed their commitment to equitable vaccine access.
quote-text: ‘Everyone, including refugees, can have a powerful impact on society. But as we celebrate refugees’ courage and contributions – including in the fight for racial justice and on the front lines of the Covid-19 pandemic – we should also recognise the challenges they face and offer them the protections they deserve’.
quote-author: Assistant Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School Aditi Hazra

title: Cambridge, UK centre advocates for the integration of refugee doctors into the healthcare system
text: Cambridge, UK’s Centre for the Study of Global Human Movement and the Syria Public Health Network have advocated for the integration of refugee doctors into the health services. One means of doing this has been by increasing the portability of medical certifications.
quote-text: ‘It really is in our interest that we support refugee doctors to enter our workforce. In the aftermath of the Covid-19 crisis we are in desperate need of their knowledge and skills’.
quote-author: Consultant in infectious diseases at Imperial College NHS Healthcare Trust Dr Aula Abbara
stats-comment:
Are needed to reach universal health coverage by 2030 (WHO, 2020)
1 dot = 1,000,000 people

title: Nepal sees recruiters reintegrate returnee migrants into labour force
text: Nepalese recruiters have played a key role in integrating the approximately 250,000 returning Nepalese migrants into the local labour market. Recruitment agencies, traditionally intermediaries for Nepalese migrant workers moving abroad, have been important resources for migrant welfare during the pandemic and in the recovery.
quote-text: ‘Recruitment agencies are also on the frontlines of helping migrant workers get home and supporting those who have already returned to access social assistance, seek alternative livelihood opportunities and navigate the challenges related to reintegration in a time of mandatory quarantine and social distancing’.
quote-author: IOM Deputy Director General Laura Thompson
stats-comment:
Nepalese working abroad have lost their job during the first two months of lockdown (Nepal Foreign Employment Board, 2020)

title: Turkish immigrants’ children develop successful Covid-19 vaccine (BioNTech-Pfizer vaccine)
text: BioNTech has developed the 'BioNTech-Pfizer vaccine', with 90% effectiveness in fighting Covid-19. The company was founded by Dr Ugur Sahin and Dr Ozlem Tureci, who are the children of Turkish migrants.
quote-text: ‘It could be the beginning of the end of the COVID era’.
quote-author: Dr Ugur Sahin

title: Taiwan subsidises Covid-19 quarantine fees for migrant farm workers
text: Taiwan grants every migrant farm worker a subsidy covering 50 percent of the quarantine fees, which should not exceed NT$10,500 (US$368). The measure is in response to calls by the country’s agricultural businesses, which have experienced a labor shortage, according to the Council of Agriculture.
quote-text: ‘The measure is in response to calls by the country’s agricultural businesses, which have experienced a labor shortage’.
quote-author: Council of Agriculture

foreign workers live in Saudi Arabia.

quote-author: International Labour Organisation

title: Germany implements crisis support platform for migrant entrepreneurs
text: Germany has implemented a number of specific support measures for migrant entrepreneurs, including an online platform with information on available crisis support measures in five languages and a network of dedicated caseworkers to support ailing migrant business in all federal states, including with respect to the filing of applications for state aid.

title: Norway gives cash assistance to increase migrant labour market participation
text: The Norwegian government has proposed a package of measures of NOK 456 million targeted towards immigrants, aimed at providing more assistance and increasing competence to facilitate swifter participation and inclusion into the labour market.

title: France allows foreign-trained health workers to work in non-medical roles in health sector
text: France has allowed the employment of foreign-trained health workers in non-medical occupations in the health sector.

text: Italy has enabled a temporary licencing scheme for doctors with foreign medical degrees.

title: Australia lifts the working hours cap on international students working in essential services
text: Australia has removed the cap on the maximum permitted hours of work for international students employed in essential services in the certain circumstances: employed by an aged care approved provider or Commonwealth-funded aged care service provider, employed by a registered National Disability Insurance Scheme provider, or enrolled in a health care related course and are supporting the health effort against Covid-19, as directed by health officials.

title: Canada lifts the working hours cap on international students working in essential services.

title: New Zealand allows temporary migrant workers more flexibility in hours and roles
text: New Zealand has allowed temporary migrant workers in essential services to adjust their work hours and perform different roles for their current employer or move to a different employer on the current role.

title: Czech Republic allows migrant workers who lost jobs to change to alternate employer
text: The Czech Republic has allowed migrant workers who have lost their job to receive authorisation to change employer as well as sector.

title: Ireland allows more foreign doctors to apply for trainee specialist schemes
text: Migrant doctors with internships previously not recognised by the Irish Medical Council are now able to apply for trainee specialist schemes. Previously, the Irish Medical Council only recognised non-EU internships from Australia, Malaysia, New Zealand, Pakistan, Sudan, South Africa, the UK and Malta. Non-EEA doctors who had trained in other countries and worked in Irish hospitals were not eligible for trainee schemes to become consultants or general practitioners.

title: Singapore start-up helps migrants through their new job-matching platform
text: Singapore-registered start-up, Sama, helps migrants through their new job-matching platform. It cuts out agents who can charge up to two months' wages to secure a job by convincing companies to pay the fee rather than workers.
quote-text: ‘We believe that workers are more productive when they are working not to avoid debt but to earn more and build a life’.
quote-author: Kirtan Patel, Co-Founder, Sama
stats-comment: foreign workers live in Singapore (Nikkei Asia, 2020). 1 dot = 100,000 people

title: The Philippines sets up a cash programme for displaced migrant workers

quote-text: ‘Whatever happens, I'm with my family. But of course, I can't help thinking about the future’.
quote-author: Edilberto Trinidad, electrician, Manila
stats-comment: displaced migrant workers receive cash assistance in the Philippines (Philippines Labour Department, 2020). 1 dot = 10,000 people

title: Egypt sets up cash assistance for irregular workers in sectors severely hit by Covid-19

title: Sicily asks Cuba to send medics to help fight a second wave of Covid-19

quote-author: Renato Costa, Sicily’s Covid-19 Emergency Commissioner
